body.p:
To His Excellency B Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky.

Your Petitioner Wm Langdon, states that he was fined fifty dollars in the city court of Louisville, at the ^September 1859^ Term -- for an assault & battery alleged to have been committed on a negro man. He alleges that the negro man was in company with some white women, where he came where they was, were, and the negro was insolvent and guilty of outrageous & bad conduct toward him, which caused the difficulty, very little injury was done him, and many persons in this city could have done what petitioner did & the matter would have not have been noticed, Petitioner, was down the river between Louisville & New Orleans when the case was tried, and a Judgment had against him on his own admissions as to the assault -- He had no opportunity to defend the case, and had he been present & prepared his defense, he is certain that the Jury would have acquitted him. He is very poor, and wholly unable to pay said fine -- being hardly able to pay the costs in this case, He assures your Excellency that difficulties of this character, an unusual matter with him & he most respectfully asks your Excellency to remit the fine promising & --
We the undersigned citizens of the portion of Louisville, in which the Petr Wm Langdon resides most respectfully Join in his petition & ask your Excellency to remit the foregoing aforementioned fine.

Isham Talbot
W. G. Reasor
William Gregory
Alfred Haffeld
Jenkins Figg
Ed. Meglemry
J. M. Campbell
Ben Figg Sr
W. W. Owen
henry Munchhof
